text:
*Price Guilt*
I run a consultancy but still do a bit of freelance writing for some SEO agencies (for their own blog content). I never feel like I’m charging too much and tend to charge based on value, not output. The agency I write for currently paid me $25K for an ultimate guide I wrote for our own blog awhile back (it was ranking for a lot of things he wanted to rank for and had a few dozen backlinks—hence the price premium).

I’m currently writing 4 _thought leadership style articles_ per month for that same company at a rate of $4300/article.

*Takeaway:* It comes down to what the market is willing to pay for the value you provide.

*Working All the Time*
I run a business and have no life because of it. So this is something I still struggle with as well. Things have gotten better over the past few months as I began removing distractions (e.g. I don’t check email until 1300h) and time block out everything so I can stay focused and get more deep work done.
